chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain HSED or GED.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.  Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges.  All to be paid over probation.  Upon revocation, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

timeConds.notes: The last four (4) months may be served at DRC if accepted, conditional upon absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Grant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Request For Good Time Credit received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for good time credit.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Brian Grant in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 years 6 months, with credit for 34 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 months; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  This sentence stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 3 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-Condition time 9 months HOC.  Last 4 months may be served at DRC if accepted, conditional upon absolute sobriety.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with Roni G. 
--Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED
Restitution set at zero.
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge over probation; any balance be converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation; any balance be converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  kmw
dated 4/7/14 from defendant.  kmw

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Brian Grant in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Bail arguments heard and denied.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing calendared for APRIL 28, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Brian Grant in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an AMENDED INFORMATION as to Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Operating Motor Vehicle without Owners Consent, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.23(3) , a class I FELONY.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order.  kmw
Defendant to be turned over to JPoint.  kmw

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court to address JPoint violations / discharge; defendant admonished.  Based on the violation report and history state requesting bail modification.  Arguments heard.  Bail set.  State filed then withdrew Amended Information.  Case remains calendared for pleah hearing 4/8/24, 8:30am.  kmw

JPoint Notice of Discharge.  kmw
(early review 3/28, 8:30am)

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  34.  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Zach Wittchow, student intern under the supervision of James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 1/24/14.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RONI G. AND WINDSOR COURT APARTMENTS (ALL GROUNDS, BUILDINGS, PARKING LOTS, GARAGES, ETC.)
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brian Grant in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Brian Grant in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
